org.codefarm.engine

Class CodeSpace

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codefarm.engine.CodeSpace

  • public class CodeSpace
extends java.lang.Object
    Instance of a code generation and formatting engine, or Code Space. Instances of this object hold their own code generation state and therefore guarantee the production of unique codes within the context of the instance, for the life of the instance.

    A front end may hold one or more code spaces at any time. The primary method genCodes(int n) is used to return the next n unique codes from this code space.

    Author:
    Oliver Thomas

    • Method Detail

      • genCodes

        public java.util.ArrayList<Code> genCodes(int n)
        Generate the next n unique codes in this code space, and update the state ready for the next call.

        The method currently uses the CodeGenerator next() method to retrieve the codes, and then shuffles the resulting set before returning. This uses the built in Collections.shuffle API. This was included before the CodeGenerator was as refined as it is now (i.e. there were concerns over the distribution of the returned results). The CodeGenerator now has very good distribution, so it may not be necessary now.

        Parameters:
        n - The number of codes to generate
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of generated Code objects
